At that time, in the country of KauÅ›ÄmbÄ«, there was an elder
named SucandrÄ.
His faculties were tranquil, and his mind and thoughts were tranquil.
He had many sons and daughters, and many servants and maids.
He had pure faith.
He went to where the Buddha was, bowed his head to the Buddha's feet,
circumambulated him a hundred thousand times, and then stood to one side.
With palms joined in respect, he addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One, I wish to ask the TathÄgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One,
about a few doubts I have.
I only pray that, out of great compassion, you will take pity on me and grant permission.
At that time, the World-Honored One said to the elder:ğŸ”½Ask as you wish.

will bring joy to your mind.
When the elder heard these words, he was overjoyed.
World-Honored One, how can good men and good women, those who are poor and destitute, become wealthy?
How can those who are sick be free from illness?
At that time, the World-Honored One said to Elder Wonderful Moon,
Why do you ask this?
The elder then said to the Buddha again,
World-Honored One, we laypeople have many relatives.
Our wealth and possessions are few, making it difficult to support ourselves.
Moreover, we have many illnesses.
We only wish that the World-Honored One would reveal the essential teachings,
so that the poor may forever be free from poverty,
and their storehouses, wealth, and treasures will all be filled to the brim.
Sustaining their households, wives, children, and relatives, those who come seeking will certainly give rise to joy.
Be great benefactors.
May their storehouses, gold, silver, precious treasures, wish-fulfilling maá¹‡i jewels, vajra gems, Å›aá¹…kha shells, Å›rÄ« (red) pearls, agate, and gold treasures be abundant and inexhaustible.
Providing for relatives and extensively practicing generosity to benefit sentient beings.
At that time the World-Honored One said to the elder Subhadra:
Good man, in the past, incalculably long eons ago, I encountered a Buddha, a World-Honored One.
His name was Vajra-wielding Sea Sound TathÄgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One.
From that TathÄgata I received this Rain of Jewels DhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
I upheld, recited, contemplated, rejoiced in, and extensively explained it to others.

if there are evil-minded humans, non-humans, yaká¹£as, rÄká¹£asas, piÅ›Äcas, bhÅ«tas, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as, upastá¹›á¹‡as, pÅ«tanÄs, and kaá¹­apÅ«tanÄs,
they cannot harm [one].
Moreover, there are ghosts that eat human fat, marrow, pus, blood, snot, spittle, and excrement, who wish to come and disturb [one],
they cannot create obstacles.
The Buddha said to Subhadra:
If there are good men who think of it in their minds and hold it in their hands, or write it down,
But hear their names, uphold them, rejoice in them, and extensively expound them for others.
Those good men and good women will enjoy peace and happiness for a long time.
It is for the sake of the peaceful and abundant provisions for yoga.
If there are people who wish to uphold this Rain of Treasures DhÄraá¹‡Ä«,
They should make offerings to all TathÄgatas.
For one night, two nights, or three nights,
Solemnly recite and uphold it.
The respectful and pure faith in the Three Jewels will delight all the devas.
It will then rain wealth, treasures, and grains.

Svaha 61 The Buddha told the elder Subhadra:
This is called the Rain-Treasure Dharani.
By the power of this dharani,
Illness, hunger, famine, and the karma of pestilence will all be eliminated.
If good men and good women first make offerings to all Tathagatas,
And recite and uphold this dharani uninterruptedly for a day and a night,
Then treasures will rain down in their home like a great man's wealth.
All calamities and misfortunes will be completely eliminated.
Therefore, good men should uphold this Rain-Treasure Dharani,
And extensively explain it to others.
Excellent, World-Honored One!
The elder Subhadra, hearing what the Buddha said, rejoiced and leaped with joy.
I now receive this Rain-Treasure Dharani from the Buddha.
I will uphold, recite, and extensively explain it to others.
At that time, the elder Subhadra, having received the Buddha's teachings,
Circumambulated the World-Honored One hundreds of thousands of times to the right,
joined palms in respect, bowed his head to the feet, and joyfully departed.
At that time the Buddha told the Venerable Ä€nanda,
You go to the house of the elder Sumukha.
See that in the elder's various storehouses, the wealth, grain, precious objects, and provisions are now all completely full.
At that time the Venerable Ä€nanda, having received the Buddha's instruction,
went to the house of the elder Sumukha in the great city of KauÅ›ÄmbÄ«.
Having entered, he saw that in the storehouses the wealth and treasures were all completely full.
Having seen this, he was greatly delighted and returned.
At that time the Venerable Ä€nanda, astonished and never having seen such a thing before, was greatly delighted and said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One, for what reason are the storehouses in the house of the elder Sumukha completely full?
The Buddha said,
Good man, the elder Sumukha has pure faith in me.
He has received and upheld this Rain of Jewels DhÄraá¹‡Ä«.
He has expounded it for all sentient beings.
Therefore, Ananda, uphold this dharani and widely proclaim it to others.
I observe with the Buddha eye that in the world, among devas, humans, maras, brahma gods, and shramanas,
no one can create obstacles for those who uphold this Rain of Jewels Dharani.
Why is this?
Because the Tathagata does not speak differently.
Because this mantra phrase is indestructible.
This dharani is not even heard by sentient beings without good roots.
How much less can they write, uphold, recite, or chant it?
Why is this?
It is proclaimed by the true words of all Tathagatas.
It is rejoiced in by all Tathagatas.ğŸ”½It is praised by all Tathagatas.
It is extolled by all Tathagatas.
It is planted by all Tathagatas.
Ananda said to the Buddha, Excellent, World-Honored One!
With wonderful verses, he spoke in praise, saying,
The Buddhas are inconceivable, and so is the Buddha Dharma.
Faith is inconceivable, and so is its karmic retribution.
The omniscient one, the Dharma King, is unborn and unceasing.
Having already reached the other shore, I bow my head to the Buddha's courage.
At that time, the Venerable Ananda
heard the Buddha speak this Rain of Jewels Dharani Sutra.
He rejoiced greatly and said to the Buddha,
World-Honored One, what should this essential Dharma be called?
How should we uphold this sutra?
The Buddha told Ananda,
This sutra is called The Questions of the Elder Sudatta.
You should uphold it.
It is also called The Ability to Obtain All Wealth, Jewels, and Treasures.
It is also called The Rain of Jewels Dharani Teaching Praised by All Tathagatas.
You should uphold it.
At that time, after the Bhagavan had spoken this sutra,
the innumerable bhikshus, bodhisattvas, devas, humans, asuras, and all the great assemblies
heard what the Buddha had said and greatly rejoiced. They believed in and accepted it, and practiced accordingly.
The mantra of the mind is:
